moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 h6: Strange but not too terrible. Just prevents Bg5 so Black can play Nf6 easily.
moves.4. d4 exd4 5. Nxd4 Qf6: Defeats the purpose of h6 and brings the Q in a bit early.
moves.6. Be3:
c3 was a possibility but didn't want to block in N at b1.
Nxc6 would work but provides Black with a stronger pawn center.
moves.6... Bc5 7. c3 d6: b6 could have been another option to develop the white squared bishop.
moves.8. O-O Bxd4 9. cxd4 a6 10. Nc3: Not to prevent b5 but mainly to consider Nd5 eventually.
moves.10... Nge7 11. f4: An under-utilized move imo. Prepares e5 and to some degree d5.
moves.11... Ng6:
Attacking the center with pieces.
Unfortunately there is not enough pawn support for this.
moves.12. f5 Nf8 13. Nd5 Qd8 14. Qf3:
Too early for f6 or e5.
Makes room for putting the R at a1 into play.
